clinical_study.brief_title: Validation of User Needs of the Point Digit With Partial Hand Amputees
clinical_study.official_title: Validation of User Needs of the Point Digit With Partial Hand Amputees

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of the device feasibility study will be to validate the user needs of the Point Digit system. This study will be a single group intervention model where one group of 5 partial hand amputees will be asked to perform several tasks. Successful completion of a task results in a fulfilled user need. Failure to complete a task results in an unfulfilled user need.

primary_outcome.description: User wears Point Digit(s) for a full day (Pass/Fail)
User flexes and extends the Point Digit(s) without using contralateral hand (Pass/Fail)

primary_outcome.measure: VAL-3.1: System Robustness Validation Test with 25 lb Bag
primary_outcome.description: User lifts a 25 lb. bag with Point Digit(s) (Pass/Fail)

primary_outcome.measure: VAL-3.2: Robustness Validation Test with Hammer
primary_outcome.description: User grips a hammer with Point Digit(s) and drives a nail into a piece of wood (Pass/Fail)
User releases Point Digit(s) while performing an active grasp by pressing the dorsal button (Pass/Fail)
User positions Point Digit(s) into each of the locking positions (Pass/Fail)
User activates spring-back mechanism by using (1) contralateral hand, (2) tabletop, and (3) side or thigh (Pass/Fail)
User grips a 5 lb. cylindrical smooth object using Point Digit(s) for 10 seconds (Pass/Fail)

primary_outcome.measure: VAL-8: Fine Motor Function Validation Test
primary_outcome.description: User picks up 1 coin from a smooth tabletop (Pass/Fail)

primary_outcome.measure: VAL-9: Overall Function & Robustness Validation Test

arm_group.description: Patient is temporarily fit with Point Digit partial hand prosthetic system

intervention.description: The Point Digit partial hand prosthetic system consists of 1-4 ratcheting mechanical digits and a mounting bracket

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Partial hand amputees with absence of index and/or middle fingers and presence of thumb. Additional finger loss is acceptable if all other criterion are met.
- Fluent in English
- Individuals aged 18 or greater
Exclusion Criteria:
- Significant cognitive deficits as determined upon clinical evaluation
- Significant neurological deficits as determined upon clinical evaluation
- Significant physical deficits of the residual limb impacting full participation in the study as determined upon clinical evaluation
- Uncontrolled pain or phantom pain impacting full participation in the study as determined upon occupational therapist evaluation
- Serious uncontrolled medical problems as judged by the project therapist.
